intro: Ficaria transsilvanica, commonly known as the Transylvanian figwort, is a perennial herb native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Ficaria transsilvanica is often found in calcareous soils and is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
